title: The Speed Project: The secret 'Fight Club'-style race between Los Angeles and Las Vegas
description: No website, no rules, no official route, no spectators. The Speed Project, a 350-mile race between Los Angeles and Las Vegas, has become the hottest event in ultra-running.

title: Javad Marandi: Tory donor's link to massive money laundering probe
description: Javad Marandi's foreign firms were at the centre of an global investigation, BBC News can finally reveal.

title: 'That's the end of them' - Leicester look 'gone' after Liverpool loss
description: Leicester's heavy defeat by Liverpool could be "the end of them" as a Premier League club as relegation looms ever nearer.

title: Brighton: Goalkeeper Jason Steele says there was 'a point I hated football'
description: Brighton goalkeeper Jason Steele says he reached a point where he "hated" football before rejuvenating his career on the south coast.

title: Davina McCall and Sir Salman Rushdie win at British Book Awards
description: Menopausing is Book of the Year and Salman Rushdie gets a special accolade at British Book Awards

title: Tuesday's transfer gossip: Silva, Rice, Mac Allister, Mount, Neves, Szoboszlai, Gallagher, Maddison
description: Paris St-Germain want Bernardo Silva to replace Lionel Messi, Arsenal will offer West Ham £90m for Declan Rice, Mauricio Pochettino is set for Mason Mount talks, plus more.

title: Leicester 0-3 Liverpool: Curtis Jones and Trent Alexander-Arnold goals pile pressure on Foxes
description: Curtis Jones scores twice as Liverpool brush aside Leicester to maintain their winning streak and push the Foxes closer to relegation.

title: UK men offered £10K to pose as dads in visa scam, BBC investigation finds
description: An undercover probe finds agents brokering deals between migrant women and men with UK passports.

title: New Zealand hostel fire: At least six dead and more missing in Wellington
description: Wellington fire commander Nick Pyatt says the blaze is the city's "worst nightmare".

title: Durham report finds FBI probe into Trump-Russia ties was flawed
description: Special Counsel John Durham was looking into alleged wrongdoing by the FBI.

title: VAR: Release of in-game audio a 'small step forward', says referees' chief Howard Webb
description: Releasing in-game VAR audio of decision-making is a "small step forward" and something the PGMOL will look to do more next season, says referees' chief Howard Webb.

title: Piers Morgan was told story was from voicemails, court hears
description: Royal journalist claims the ex-Daily Mirror editor was briefed about source of Kylie Minogue story.

title: Florida teacher Jenna Barbee says she faces investigation for playing Disney movie
description: Florida teacher Jenna Barbee says she played pupils Strange World, which has a character who is gay.

title: London Irish: Premiership club given 30 May sale deadline or risk suspension
description: London Irish are given a deadline of 30 May to complete their takeover or risk being suspended from the Premiership next season.

title: ExxonMobil settles decades-old torture case with Indonesian villagers
description: The villagers allege torture, sexual assault and beatings by soldiers contracted by the oil company.

title: Supermarkets investigated over food and fuel prices
description: The competition watchdog will look at whether a failure in competition means customers are overpaying.

title: Tim Westwood hotline receives 'important information'
description: A review is being held into what the BBC knew about former DJ Tim Westwood's alleged conduct.

title: Gwynedd: New 'multi-purpose' sheep bred successfully
description: A merino ram from Australia was used to create a new "multi-purpose" breed on a Gwynedd farm.

title: Wayne Couzens: Met PC missed chance to investigate, hearing told
description: She is accused of failing to investigate Wayne Couzens properly over two instances of flashing.

title: Rugby League World Cup: France pulls out of hosting tournament in 2025
description: France pulls out of hosting the 2025 Rugby League World Cup with organisers citing financial reasons for the decision.

title: Geraint Thomas ready to prove a point in Giro d'Italia's leader's pink jersey
description: Geraint Thomas hopes his Giro d'Italia luck has changed after inheriting the leader's maglia rosa following Remco Evenepoel's Covid withdrawal.

title: Arsenal & Man City: When teams have let Premier League title leads slip
description: While pundits and fans debate whether Arsenal have 'bottled' an eight-point Premier League lead, BBC Sport looks at other substantial leads which have been overturned in title races.

title: Vernon Kay: 'I'm not a young DJ, I'm 50 next year' says new BBC Radio 2 presenter
description: The BBC Radio 2 presenter reacts to criticism that the BBC are replacing older DJs.

title: Microsoft's Activision takeover approved by EU after UK veto
description: The proposed $69bn acquisition of Activision is splitting global regulators over competition concerns

title: Johnny Kitagawa: Calls for probe after J-pop agency abuse apology
description: Japanese talent agency Johnny and Associates apologises over sex abuse claims against its late founder Johnny Kitagawa.

title: Royal Mail to be investigated for missed delivery targets
description: The postal service faces another fine by the industry watchdog for falling short on first class mail.

title: Turkey's presidential race to be decided in run-off
description: President Erdogan is favourite to stay in power, with a lead of almost 5% over his main rival.

title: Local elections 2023: Voter ID backfired on Tories, says Rees-Mogg
description: The ex-minister suggests his party brought in the controversial measure to boost their election chances.

title: Center Parcs owner Brookfield puts holiday chain up for sale
description: The private equity owner of the resort firm wants to sell the business for up to £5bn.

title: Chris Mason: Vocal Tory right give PM a headache
description: Private concerns about the direction of the Tory Party under Rishi Sunak this week became more public.

title: Wimborne and Poole: Police appeal after 13 vehicles set on fire
description: Cars were set alight in Wimborne and Poole from Sunday night into the early hours of Monday.

title: Austrian train plays Hitler speech over loudspeaker
description: Staff and passengers were "upset" by the incident, for which two people have been charged.

title: Boy, 11, Tasered by police after knife stand-off in South Ayrshire
description: Officers used a stun gun on the boy after being called to a caravan park in South Ayrshire.

title: Florida professor breaks record for time spent living underwater
description: Researcher Joseph Dituri has been living underwater in the Florida Keys for more than 70 days.

description: England all-rounder Nat Sciver-Brunt speaks about her mental health, having recently taken a short break from the sport, and the upcoming Ashes series.

description: An expert says the discovery of the striking sea creature in a rock pool is amazing.

description: The British Championship at Foxhill in Swindon was abandoned after a man in his 50s died.

description: The 49-year-old takes over the mid-morning slot from Ken Bruce, who hosted it for more than 30 years.

title: Vice and Motherboard owner files for bankruptcy
description: Vice Media Group, which was once valued at $5.7bn, is set to be sold but will keep operating.

title: UK's first driverless bus begins passenger service in Edinburgh
description: Stagecoach's fleet of autonomous buses will run every half hour between Fife and Edinburgh.

description: Gary Lineker bends the Match of the Day Top 10 rules as he allows Ian Wright to be included as an additional 11th name in this week's episode on the game's 'dark arts'.

description: An undercover journalist for Panorama is diagnosed and given drugs without proper checks.

description: Towie star Gemma Collins is urging people to be more open and less embarrassed about the subject.

title: UK must train own workers to curb migration - Braverman
description: The home secretary will say there is "no good reason" the UK cannot train its own workers in a speech later.

title: Watch: Telecom tower buckles in Myanmar cyclone

title: A-levels and GCSEs: Covid support in place as exams begin
description: Exams are getting under way for most students in England, Wales and Northern Ireland.

title: Zibo barbecue: Millions bring sudden fame to industrial Chinese city
description: Previously a sleepy industrial city, Zibo has been at the centre of a post-lockdown social media frenzy.

title: Atiq Ahmed: The life of India's gangster-politician killed on live TV
description: Atiq Ahmed was an MP but also had around 100 criminal cases against him.
